head.title: Olympic Events for Chiefs: Sunning and Burger Flipping

hedline.hl1: Olympic Events for Chiefs: Sunning and Burger Flipping

abstract.p: IBM, major sponsor, rents cruise liner, docked next to Sydney's landmark Opera House, and will fly about 2,000 employees and clients to Australia for Olympic games (S)

block.p: If you're a chief executive attending the Olympics, where do you stay? Forget the local Ritz-Carlton. Get yourself a yacht, or better yet, an entire cruise liner and dock it next to Sydney's landmark Opera House. That's what Louis Gerstner of I.B.M. did. Mr. Gerstner is staying on a giant cruise liner that I.B.M. rented for the Olympics; he will play host to dozens of parties and meetings there. As a major sponsor of the Games, I.B.M. is flying about 2,000 employees and clients to Sydney to show off the technology it developed for the Games.
An I.B.M. spokesman refused to say how much the floating accommodations cost.
